channel.title: Captains-logs on Vite & Rêves
channel.description: Recent content in Captains-logs on Vite & Rêves

item.title: 2019-09-24 Avlaki Bay to Monemvasia
item.description: From: Avlaki bay, Peloponnesos To: Monemvasia, Peloponnesos

item.title: 2019-09-23 Avlaki Bay
item.description: At: Avlaki bay, Peloponnesos Avlaki bay is magnificent. About half a mile long and 300m wide, surrounded on three sides by steep mountains, with a half sand, half pebble beach, and most important for sailors: a sandy bottom.

item.title: 2019-09-22 Hydra to Avlaki Bay
item.description: From: Hydra, island Hydra To: Avlaki bay, Peloponnesos The wind was ok this morning. It had decreased during the night and the sea outside also looked less agitated.

item.title: 2019-09-21 Hydra
item.description: At: Hydra, island Hydra At night, the wind picked up. A lot. A northern wind, and we were tied to the south side. Not good. As mentioned in the pilot, the holding in Hydra port is not very good and it’s recommended to tie off to the north side in strong nothern winds.

item.title: 2019-09-20 Hydra
item.description: From: Mandraki bay, island Hydra To: Hydra, island Hydra The wind didn’t shift during the night after all. It shifted during the morning when we were contemplating having breakfast.

item.title: 2019-09-19 Lavrion to Hydra
item.description: From: Lavrion Port To: Mandraki bay, island Hydra Some days are perfect sailing days. So was this one. 15 knots, downwind sailing, almost no waves. It didn’t start as the perfect sailing day though.

item.title: 2019-09-18 Lavrion
item.description: From: Lavrion Olympic Marine To: Lavrion Port We wanted to be closer to the Lavrion shops and restaurants, so we moved Vite & Rêves to the town port.

item.title: 2019-09-17 Lavrion
item.description: At: Lavrion Olympic Marine We’re getting ready to leave for our world trip. We took 5 small suitcases and 2 big ones of clothes and stuff, 3 kids and 2 Parents with us to start.
